website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-control unit with a retractable nozzle that self-cleans, no electricity required.
pros: Installs quickly and fits most toilets
Has a strong spray that gets the job done
cons: Unit occasionally leaks and does not have a dual-nozzle construction

customer_reviews.title: Great Bidet but you NEED TO KNOW THESE THINGS!
customer_reviews.text: 1. Must have an elongated toilet not round. 2. BOTTOM OF SEAT MUST BE FLAT. if it's concave it will press on the Bidet. 3. You will also want some spacers to put on the bottom of the seat to raise it a bit where the Bidet boosts the seat in the back. 4. Purchase the T adapter below for additional pressure control... You'll be glad you did! Luxe Metal T-adapter with Shut-off Valve, 3-way Tee Connector, Chrome Finish, for Luxe Neo Bidets  See video for additional info.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D. Davis (Author - @TattooPreacher)

customer_reviews.title: My poor bottom!
customer_reviews.text: Do you like your anus? THEN DON'T BUY THIS. It's ANGRY and is happy to let your bottom feel it's cold, cutting wrath. Seriously. I barely turned the knob and it cut a place that shouldn't be cut! Japan never let me down during my stay, so I wanted my own. Don't go cheap when it comes to your nethers! Ow, ow, ow!
customer_reviews.author: Lady

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging.
customer_reviews.text: I love my bidet and the $35.99 I paid before it prior to the coronavirus. It works great and certainly saves on toilet paper. The 100% markup during a crisis is ridiculous though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon creasy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic T connector failed and flooded my bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bidet for the few weeks it worked. I have IBS sand can't believe I've lived life without one of these before. That being said, I'll have to go find another one. The T connector included in this kit is made of flimsy plastic. The plastic threading failed and flooded my upstairs bathroom. Luckily I was home and able to run upstairs to shut off the water (and downstairs to shut off electric panel for lights underneath the toilet). What a mess...
customer_reviews.author: Lando

customer_reviews.title: Broken already.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this just under 3 weeks ago. It worked fine after installing, but a couple of days ago the self cleaning mechanism does not work. I turn the knob to self clean and nothing happens at all. Very disappointed that this has already broken after owning for such a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: BET YOURE NOT LAUGHING NOW
customer_reviews.text: Sensitive, weird Americans unwilling to try new things, wiping yourselves with your dinner napkins. They laughed at me, now they'll see. They'll all see! K but seriously this is the second one I have bought. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Aim not true.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two Astor bidets they cost less and work better. When we moved, I thought I would “upgrade” to these, as they are prettier, have a sleeker design and are obstensibly self cleaning. The are angled wrong for the derrière and often rebound off your bottom and leak out beneath the toilet seat. This is my second time trying a review. They rejected my first one claiming that have had false reviews. As I panned it and purchased it because of the good reviews, I feel taken by the company and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.S

customer_reviews.title: Crappy (no pun intended) T adaptor
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: So I'm updating my review to 2 stars because it works well upon separately buying a better T-adaptor. Can't really give it a higher rating given that it shipped with a low-quality crucial part. Original review: The T adapter that it comes with is metal. I installed everything and made sure it was all tight, but upon turning the water supply back on it sprayed from the adapter where it screws into the toilet. I'm gonna buy another T adapter. If that works, I'll give it 2 stars instead of 1 (but not more given that it didn't work out of the box).
customer_reviews.author: bassoongoon

customer_reviews.title: Why did the price go up ??! Price gouging?
customer_reviews.text: I was please with this product except for the fact that you can’t control the temperature. And now the price has increased 15.00 I wonder why ? Or why am I not surprised the price went up on This product. I’m not sure this is even legal.
customer_reviews.author: angel vi

customer_reviews.title: Should be renamed “Rectal Pressure Washer”
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve ever wanted to know what if feels like to have your bung hole power washed, just get this bad boy. I have never even made it to the “low” setting. The tiny movement from off towards low is enough to shoot 7ft up onto my bathroom wall, as well as make me run screaming. My husband apparently is a masochist and enjoys this thing so it stays on our toilet. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Best thing that’s happened this crap year so far
customer_reviews.text: I’m really glad I bought this right before the Great Toilet Paper Shortage of 2020. I kept telling my friends a few weeks before the apocalypse that they needed to get on the bidet boat, and they laughed at me. Who’s laughing now? My ass is clean and they’re rationing rolls, or taking multiple showers while in quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Nix

customer_reviews.title: Best. Purchase. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow! This is a game changer. I'm a big burly guy, and was very hesitant. But once I used it I don't know if I can go back. It gets you clean, CLEAN! it's going to reduce my toilet paper usage by a ton. **Here's a BIG ProTip: if you install this thing and get BLASTED off the seat (lol), turn down your toilet pressure. Once it is adjusted the low doesn't feel like a fire hose, and your toilet will fill just fine. ** I strongly suggest this to anyone who wants to try it. It's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: J.Moore

customer_reviews.title: Pit-free prune
customer_reviews.text: Amazing thing this bidet contraption. Go ahead and hoard the TP, I won’t need it anymore, pit-free prune here. I have an oblong Kolher brand toilet and the toilet seat screws weren’t long enough to accommodate the extra thickness added by the bidet, had to get some longer screws from the hardware store. As others have said, adding the bidet to your toilet seat makes the front of the toilet seat uneven and lifted up. I’ll need to add some spacer washers to the back to compensate for this. Very easy to install and wish I’d bought one years ago when we all had dysentery, just kidding! Get one already.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie

customer_reviews.title: Do you like making a 3rd hole for yourself?
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Easy as can be to install, feels sturdy enough. CON: It has the pressure of hurricane Katrina on my b-hole. WAY too strong a current, even on the lowest setting. It's uncomfortable. I've used dozens of bidets across Europe/Asia and this one is by far the worst and most uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Runaway5

customer_reviews.title: No toilet paper ruining your day no problem Buy a Bidet
customer_reviews.text: Why get scalped by covert toilet paper internet sales. Beat Corona price gouging and purchase a bidet. Better for the environment as well. I like this one after a lot of research as the only one that came with all Brass fittings. That makes a difference as if these fail and pop you will flood your house rapidly. Go Brass. You will need to buy Bumpers too so your toilet seat doesn't crack, those are purchased separately. The Bidet is in the back of the seat and raises the back a tad so without bumpers creates uneven weight distribution that can crack the seat. Worth the extra 4-6 bucks to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: uids

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but almost doubled in price in recent weeks
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No temp control though,only cold water. Definitely does the job. Be prepared for a blast of water. The one problem i do have is with the price. I paid 35 dollars three weeks ago. If your that concerned of a toilet paper shortage since the Coronavirus outbreak,then but it. Cleary the manufacturer or Amazon are gouging the price. It's almost double.
customer_reviews.author: Brian moskaluk

customer_reviews.title: was excited about it, wish it was better
customer_reviews.text: now that it’s on im feeling kind of stuck with it.. works just ok i guess.. the sprayer is inconsistent, doesn’t quite do the job as expected.. kind of makes a mess out of your backside and then you have to use tissue anyhow.. also, the toilet seat doesn’t close correctly when it’s on.. and when you read the instructions about that it tells you to order some shims which i feel should have totally came with it!.. idk i guess two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Jones

customer_reviews.title: COSTS MUCH MORE THAN THE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Tried to install metal T-adaptor onto base of toilet and it stripped the plastic threads and leaked. Toilet mechanism had to be replaced by a plumber for $120. Then another $230 to have the bidet installed because our toilet was too close to the wall leaving no space to work with. If your toilet is too close to the wall it is near impossible to install yourself. So now that we paid an add $350 to get it installed and working, I do like the bidet. But if i had known that it would have costed me a plumber to install it, I would not have gotten it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It takes a couple of times to get used to the cold water, but after a couple of times, it's fine. Same with the spray intensity. At first, the lowest is just so weird. But after a couple of times, you can turn it up some if necessary and it's fine. If I was remodeling the bath, I would probably splurge on a standalone model with warm water, air dry, and other bells and whistles, but this works pretty well, esp. for the price. You will still need toilet paper, tho not much, just to dry off!
customer_reviews.author: myshopper

customer_reviews.title: Strong yet gentle...
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed the bidet today and couldn't wait to use it. I was nervous to use based on the previous comments of high pressure, even on the low setting but I worked up the courage after a tinkle. I slowly turned the knob and to my surprise the jet slowly splashed against my girly parts with enough pressure to clean. You have to self adjust a but to wash everything up front but works wonderfully and is gentle enough to get the job done. The pressure increases with each setting so hold on! With this, I won't have any issue surviving the toilet paper shortage of 2020!
customer_reviews.author: V. Tor

customer_reviews.title: Waste of your money and time! Don’t believe the reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Wasted 4+ hours of my life trying to install this piece of junk. The t-adapter that was sent leaks like crazy and is terrible. So I read the reviews and bought a good $18 t-adapter. I finally get it all installed with no leaks, and it doesn’t even freaking work! There is definitely water pressure but the nozzle doesn’t drop to spray at all. Piece of junk, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bax

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a bidet before. It's wonderful to be clean and need only one swipe with toilet paper to dry myself. My spouse and I were worried the water would feel cold. It does not. Apparently our bottoms are not sensitive to temperature. I have had IBS for years and although it has been well controlled for a long time, I spent many years having to wipe myself so much that it caused bleeding and hemoroids that eventually lead to extremely painful surgery. I wish I had known about bidets back then. I am sure it would have saved me a lot of discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS FOR DISABLED OR ELDERLY
customer_reviews.text: Water gets between the seat and bowl making the seat slide. I slid off several times, and didn't hit the floor because I was able to stand up and hold onto a cabinet. You need to do a butt dance to get it to hit the right area, which makes it more dangerous. The low pressure doesn't clean well and the higher presser squirts all over my legs. If you flush the toilet, the pressure lowers and then spurts out harder. Pressure is unpredictable. I require a bidet for medical reasons, so use if more frequent. I only bought this because another cheaply Made In China brand, Brondell, was impossible to install. This was easy for my friend to install.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy another bidet from this brand. The plastic was cheap and began falling apart piece by piece. It was not used that much. Just sitting on the toilet seat day after day caused it to start breaking. It took a while to get used to the hard spray, which could wet a large area of your bottom. Depending on how you wipe yourself with toilet tissue, I found that it took more toilet tissue to dry my bottom than if I had used just toilet tissue to clean myself.
customer_reviews.author: Honest review

customer_reviews.title: Leaky fittings
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t fit my toilet. Spent hrs tightening and trying to use grommets to stop it from leaking but nothing worked. I turned off the water to try again tomorrow. My roomate which never really uses my bathroom decided he needed it that night. He turned the water back on...and left it on. Whole bathroom was flooded. Downstairs neighbor had a huge bubble on their ceiling from the water leaking thru. To return it I have to drive to some random home improvement store not even close to me. I really wanted to like this butt massager/cleaner but it was destined not to work from the start.
customer_reviews.author: SiLeNt KNighT

customer_reviews.title: Wasted an hour of my life.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Everything went together. Finished installation and slowly turned the water back on and water SPRAYED out of the connection to the controller. Not from the threads but from behind them where the connecter swivels. Still want a bidet, but not this one!
customer_reviews.author: eric Thrapp

customer_reviews.title: Must have appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is one review I'm happy to do. I originally ordered the bidet as a matter of practicality, to save on buying toilet paper during the covid 19 crisis. It works perfectly! My husband installed it and it didn't take long so I'm guessing it was fairly easy. The cool water temperature is not a problem for us. The bidet does exactly what it is supposed to do. My only regret is not buying two. I wanted to check it out first; now it is out stock apparently and other vendors are selling it for twice the price. It's still worth it for a cleaner bum and money saved on TP.
customer_reviews.author: ThomCat

customer_reviews.title: You may need a different T-Adapter but Bidet works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bidet works as described. Our issue was with installation. We poured through reviews to find the solution. When we disconnected the supply hose from the toilet, the connection on our toilet was a plastic. We couldn't attach the T-adapter that came with the bidet. It felt like it was cross threading and it was leaking. The recommendation was to order this T-adapter.  It worked perfectly. It cost an additional $20.
customer_reviews.author: Ida Pucino

customer_reviews.title: How did I live my life without this?
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I’ve never used one before but have heard how good they are a few times. I finally decided to go for it since it had good reviews and was pretty low cost. I’ve never felt cleaner after #2 and stopped needing my wet wipes all together. I thought I would want the one with warm water but I only got the cold and glad I did. It’s not a big deal and the warm seems like a hassle running a hose to your hot water line. If you’re on the fence about getting this don’t hesitate. Once you get the hang of it you will love it. Simple installation too.
customer_reviews.author: Me Ted

customer_reviews.title: No reason to buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: So I’m no bidet expert. I have an issue with hemorrhoids and thought it was time I give one a try. Did some research and found this one to be highly rated. It is excellent! Installation was very easy. The unit looks neat and works great. More than enough pressure from the nozzle. I don’t know why I waited so long. I have one recommendation and that is to buy the bumpers/spacers sold separately. Because the bidet attached to the back of the seat, the stock rear spacers on your seat will no longer contact the bowl. I imagine continued use would cause the seat to bend or break.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jagacki

customer_reviews.title: My Booty is Happy!
customer_reviews.text: We didn't invest in the warm water bidet so I get an invigorating little wake up splash every time I use it. I love this thing. My husband installed it so I can't really comment on that but I didn't hear any cussing and screaming while he was in there so I assume it wasn't super difficult. My only complaint about the bidet which probably is not specific to THIS bidet, is that it makes cleaning your toilet a little bit harder (there's little nooks and crannys). Since I would rather walk on the sun than clean a crapper, this makes me slightly unhappy. But not so much that I'd give it up. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Amazon purchase I've ever made.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most useful purchase on Amazon I've ever made. It is not difficult to install and is very effective. Everyone should have one of these. Whenever I'm out in public and have to do the #2 and use toilet paper, I feel like ugh! :-( There is no comparison to using this versus to toilet paper. Not having a bidet is like taking a shower without water. Another benefit is that clean up is much faster than toilet paper alone. Also if you suffer from burning after eating hot food, this thing is like your personal little Fireman, giving cool relief to your backside. You'll also save money by using less toilet paper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So upset! They said it would be easy...
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions exactly. Took off the lid, put on the bidet, screwed lid back on and this picture is as far down the toilet seat would go. So now that that happened and had to urgently use it during installation, the guard piece totally broke. (No, not fat in the least). Tried calling twice to get a live person to no avail. They say they’re helpful and all about customer service but after holding forever, twice, nothing. Left a message and it cut me off before I could leave email address.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Every Toilet should come with this product!
customer_reviews.text: Had this installed for a little while now. I can honestly say it changes your bathroom experience. Easy installation, quality fittings and hardware. I noticed some say to replace the plastic T. Myself an a family member both received a metal T not plastic. I had them both installed in minutes. No leaks and they work better than expected. I was very skeptical at first. I can honestly say that i will never have a toilet that does not have one quipped. In these times where TP is like bottled water during a hurricane, this really helps cut back a serious amount.
customer_reviews.author: TrikCobra

customer_reviews.title: Overall not a bad experience, Will use again
customer_reviews.text: With people taking TP off the shelves like the crazy hoarders they are I decided to give this thing a try and I was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Link

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Works as intended, *Comes with Metal T
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how I survived all this time without this things. Works as intended. Cheap and easy to install. *Before I bought I got worried about reviews, came used, without metal T, came in with missing parts, etc. I read comments about these things not having the metal T, mine came with. Both of them actually because I bought 2. It is in their manual that this things come with both plastic and metal. I would advise that when you buy in amazon, make sure who your buying from. Plus amazon is really good anyway with their customer service so if you buy new and you guys get a used or parts are missing, tell amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JFPineda

customer_reviews.title: Be clean, but be warned
customer_reviews.text: I don't know I would buy this for my primary residence, but it worked great for our vacation home in Honolulu, where the tap water never really gets cold. Only negative thing I will say is that the pressure control on the device itself is not so great. It seems to be all-on or all-off. I bought a separate valve to bring the pressure down a bit. But for $50 (with the valve), it's 85% of what you need compared to one of those fancy Toto systems. And it doesn't require an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Witecki

customer_reviews.title: At war with Klingons
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? An an American with a previously unsanitary bung hole, I would have to say that this bidet has changed my life forever. It's simple to set up with basic knowledge. There is no temperature control so it's just a cold spray. But let me tell you, that first spray was better than a shot of high end narcotics. The pressure is incredible and somehow knew exactly where my filthy fart locker was. You may have to move around a little, however. Especially for the a lady's front butt. Do yourself the favor and just move on from just spreading chocolate around. Turn the knob very slowly on your first use. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Why, oh why, did I not buy this before?? We love it. The Luxe Bidet Neo 120 is easy to install and adjust on our round Bemis toilet seat and American Standard toilet. The unit came with BOTH a plastic and metal T adapter fitting. The metal one worked fine. The plastic wrench installation tools worked just OK - it's difficult to properly tighten the fitting nut without stripping the wrench. Fortunately, I had an wrench and channel lock pliers - so, no leaks. The unit itself works very well and we really like the self-cleaning feature. Knobs and valves feel solid when operating the controls. Overall we are very pleased - and very clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cliffy

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye TP. Saving a lot of "MONEY"
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these NEO 120 for both toilets and are, Very easy to install. These are the cold water only Bidet's. My Wife was a little skeptical about these but after about a week my Wife and are getting used to it, We both love them. There is only 2 settings soft and hard spray. This Bidet cleans you very very good to the point of not using any TP at all, even my Wife stopped using TP, that's awesome. Make sure when it arrives to register the pruduct to get the 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 8 of these now, one for all 3 of my bathrooms then moved and bought 2 more for new house the others were for gifts. These make you feel clean and fresh every time you go. Several friends now have them and they too are thrilled with them. I’m a 62 year old woman and I installed 5 by myself so easy to install. Customer service is the best too I needed a longer hose for one toilet and they sent it free of charge. Buy it you’ll be happy you did!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie O.

customer_reviews.title: I have a clean booty.
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this as a christmas present to myself before Covid-19 came out. People are complaining about no Toilet paper and I got a clean butt. Highly recommend Bidet's. This one doesn't have temp control but that's ok. It just means it will help wake you up in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Cleanliness
customer_reviews.text: What took me so long to get one. This product is amazing!!! In the midst of everyone scrambling to find toilet paper, I now find myself not caring anymore. Super clean feeling back there. One roll of TP has lasted over a week since I installed this Bidet that 2 people use. Do yourself a favor and order one today!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Moeller

customer_reviews.title: A great bidet, but price has gone way up
customer_reviews.text: This bidet installs in minutes and works great in every way. Five stars! However, the price has increased by $27, or 45%, in less than one year. Maybe even since the great toilet paper shortage. Coincidence or profiteering? I don’t know but that’s a big price increase.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Good and relatively inexpensive heated Bidet toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: Great solution to the recent toilet paper shortage. Wow. The warm water cleaning is great. Installation was easy, but does require an outlet to plug the unit in. I had to have the an outlet installed close enough to the toilet that the cable could reach it. I wish I had bought this years ago. I did not know what I was missing and I only use a couple of sheets of toilet paper for drying, while keeping my hands clean. And, it even has a dryer. I feel so much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Shelton

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband insisted that we get this installed on our toilet, and he has never been happier. It was easy for him to install (and he's not really a DIY guy) and it has been sturdy and working every since. The only complaint I have is that I would prefer the water to be warmed, but that is no way a problem with the product (which doesn't claim to deliver warmed water) just my personal preference. If you're looking for a toilet mounted bidet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Foster

customer_reviews.title: it might be a good addition. I ordered the extra bumpers
customer_reviews.text: I do not have a colon. My movement frequency is often. This product is very helpful. I live in Florida, so don't need the Hot Water connection, however I suspect further north, it might be a good addition. I ordered the extra bumpers, this was a good purchase too. Again, northerners may want to order the metal distribution connector. The plastic unit included, may not hold up in colder climates. I have recommended to others with similar issues. Installation is a breeze, no plumbing etc.
customer_reviews.author: LarryB

customer_reviews.title: Great mouth washer
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I have never used a bidet and this has been a new experience. The install was simple and straight forward. The controls need more fine tuning, it's either on or off there is no in between. Other than that it works well. On the plus side it is great for those nights when when you are praying to the porcelain God's, the jet works great to help remove those leftover chunks that are caught in your teeth or when you just need to rinse your mouth out. A real life saver!!!
customer_reviews.author: av8trx13

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: This was incredibly easy to set up as long as your toilet tubing and materials are intact and functioning. Pretty minimalistic appearance and not in the way. I see that some people have had to get some things to elevate the front of their toilet seat since its unlevel after installation, but for me, this level change was very minimal and I have not felt the need to level the seat back out. Easy to use and the clean feeling afterward is unparalleled. It is like a shower for your bottom each trip to the bathroom!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit standard toilet seat.
customer_reviews.text: Back of seat raises up by resting on spray nozzle. It would break the first time you sit on the seat. $10 additional for adapters if fit is only slightly off, not the case for my round American Standard toilet. Solution: They tell you to go find a seat that fits. Am I supposed to go buy random toilet seats, come home fit them on then return the ones that don't work? Returned. It would at least be nice if the instructions told you how to check for fit before you've completely installed the damn thing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S. Lux

customer_reviews.title: Must get one!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny. I was thinking of getting the Tushy, but it costs twice as much and I didn’t know if I was gonna like it. I’m glad I got this one. Installation is easy. They even supply a plastic wrench. I’m amazed with the “aim” of the water, it hits on the bullseye. Once you rinse off, you don’t even need to wipe anymore, you just drying it out, and you feel clean like just out of the shower. It’s a Must have!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsay TC

customer_reviews.title: ALL ENGLISH INSTRUCTION MANUAL XOXO
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS SO REFRESHING TO HAVE DIRECTIONS PRINTED IN ENGLISH FOR US AMERICANS IN THIS DAY AND AGE!!!! (no Spanish or other gibberish mucking up the pages). I love this bidet! This company really has its shihtzu together. KISS – Keep it simple - The kit comes with everything you need: plumbers tape, the t-valve is made of metal, little wrenches. – This is a simple, great working product, comes with all accessories, easy to install, at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: 2cool4u

customer_reviews.title: Yes, purchase it
customer_reviews.text: After setting this up and using it for two months, I can not recommend it enough. This is the perfect starter bidet for people curious about the devices. I feel clean and I'm cutting back considerbly on my toilet paper usage. I will say if you live with a woman, be sure to get the model with the front sprayer as well. I wasn't paying attention and got the wrong one at first. My mistake and I've since gotten the proper model, but even this one is fantastic to help you build up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Harris

customer_reviews.title: Everything is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works and everything is exactly at described. No, you do not need a separate lady sprayer if you can just tilt your hips a tiny bit. This sprays super soft at the lowest setting and is gentle enough for vajayjays. I was worried about this but having 2 sprays would have been unnecessary. Everything is terrific and I couldn't be happier getting all fresh. Husband was glad the T-valve was actually metal and install from the time of opening the box to spraying the kid in the face with the completed project took no more than 20 mins. No bumpers or any other part that wasn't included was needed. I think I got this at a steal for $29.97.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Posie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Save TP, and Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Easy installation with terrific instructions, and works great. I didn't want to deal with needing electricity near the toilet, and don't care about silly stuff like heated seats and such. Just a nice basic product, well-made. And it's a San Diego company, so that's a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D. White

customer_reviews.title: That Clean Feeling!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness this is soooo nice. I love that clean feeling. My husband insisted he had to have the one with hot water so I placed an order for it. The kids aren't so thrilled with it but one day I think they will come around. For the money it's well worth it. I've priced the more expensive ones but this one suits the purpose just fine. Not hard to install only takes about 10 minutes. Bought a new toilet seat that closes slow which fit perfect and no need for the bumpers everyone wrote about.
customer_reviews.author: lmca3510

customer_reviews.title: Good for potty training twins lol
customer_reviews.text: Pretty powerful lol My twins figured out they can make it shoot water clean across the bathroom. *face palm* My potty training 3 year olds really like it. It was a fathers day gift for their dad. Hes been talking about getting a bidet for like 7 years......he also likes it but the twins freaking love it. I still think it's weird and refuse to try it myself but its probably pretty useful after birth. Lol
customer_reviews.author: The Story Family

customer_reviews.title: Who would have know - it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: My youngest son (30) purchased one, than two of these a few months back and said "Dad, you need to try these". Ok. I purchased but delayed installing it for almost 3 weeks. I should have installed it day one. Easy to install with all of the hardware included. Make sure you don't test the product standing there - I heard it squirts right at you : ) You definitely will save on toilet paper and feel much cleaner. Will look at getting another one for the guest bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey kallas

customer_reviews.title: Works well but caution advised!
customer_reviews.text: When traveling I was always impressed by the fancy toilets in India and Japan, and I always wondered why a bidet wasn't standard equipment on American toilets. Finally, one that doesn't cost thousands of dollars! This installed quickly and easily. No drips yet. Others have mentioned that you need to be very careful about the water pressure, because the jet stream coming out of this thing can be fierce. You *will* seriously hurt yourself if your water supply has anything close to normal water pressure and you crank it up beyond the minimal setting. I'm surprised that this thing doesn't have a water flow control that strongly constricts the flow. But when you find the sweet spot, bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The unit was easy to install, shipped with extra hardware, and it works perfectly....but...has one near fatal design-flaw: as is, the toilet cover pushes down on it and would have broken it soon. I improvised by retrieving the two circular pieces with the notches from the old unit and stacked them each on top of the ones the new unit came with. The toilet cover now tilts slightly up in back, but the bidet itself is safe from cracking like the old one did. Going around trying to find a different toilet cover is completely out of the question...the person that suggested that in the installation booklet seems to live in some fantasy land.
customer_reviews.author: Musico

customer_reviews.title: Best quarantine purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this during the stay at home order and it took a month or so to come. With the shortage of toilet paper, it seemed like a good idea. It was easy to install and we really like it. Even the kids use our bathroom so they can use it. It is cold, no heat with it but that really isn't bad. Also can be high pressure, you have to just barely turn it on or its too harsh. But overall, easy and very useful. The Europeans are on to something!
customer_reviews.author: Ruffin Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know that bidets were that inexpensive and easy to install. The ones I knew of were a separate bowl that was plumbed to the water service and very expensive. I've suffered from hemorrhoids on and off for 20 years. This thing is a game changer. ...careful when first learning to use it though. If your water pressure is above 50 psi than it might cause soft tissue damage at full throttle. Start by barley turning the knob and waiting a few seconds before turning it higher to see what works. Don't do as I did and accidentally add another orifice to your body. (High pressure water is used to drill holes in industrial applications.) Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: So I installed it. Only use the teflon tape for attaching the bidet hose to the T connection. Not needed for the other two connections. I installed with it up against the back of the bowl. When I tightened down everything and tested, I got a weak stream up my back. Moved it forward about 1/2" and voilá worked like a charm. Nice powerful stream. When I first thought about ordering I considered the one with hot and cold. Wasn't sure about ice cold water shooting up my hind parts. Well, I needn't worry. It wasn't a bother at all. I highly recommend this. I'm ordering one for the other bathroom today.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is AWESOME!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the husband review...... Omg! This is the best thing I've ever bought! Besides my boat haha! Make sure you wipe your arse 1x and then shoot the poo! Having a hairy bunghole sucks! You get TP stuck in the forest, and trust me having Hemroids doesnt help. This has calmed the hemroids, and stopped the tp from getting caught in the ivy of the bung hole. Ty for this great product and making po0oping fun again!
customer_reviews.author: Beth G.

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: For real - if you get raw-butt from wiping too much during a bout of diarrhea, then you know the intense pain and discomfort that causes. Spray clean, dab dry. It feels cleaner because you ARE cleaner! And using less TP in the process. Bought this model over a year ago, and its holding up fine. Can't go wrong buying this one. Easy install. You won't regret it. Gentle on low settings, but gets the job done- max pressure will about lift you off the seat! Def needed sometimes. I recommend also getting a little portable hand-squeeze one until the rest of the barbaric world catches on, because once you're used to it, nothing less will do.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ball

customer_reviews.title: needs a pressure reducer
customer_reviews.text: can barely turn to low or it will give you an enema, but it saves you a lot of TP even though you have to dry off;) took 20 minutes to install, but the toilet seat is now up off the bowl until you sit down then the front of the seat touches the bowl. probably going to break the seat soon. also hope you don't live in a cold area cause the water would be a real eye opener in the am people please STOP HOARDING TP!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rieger

customer_reviews.title: #spicybumaway
customer_reviews.text: This is heaven, especially when your B-hole feels like it’s in hell from extra habanero sauce on the Cafe Rio enchilada style!! Don’t be afraid, just pull the trigger on this purchase, you won’t regret it, besides, when the Coronavirus keeps spreading and there’s a worse toilet paper shortage, you’ll be able to sit and smile 💦🔥 😊
customer_reviews.author: JMFH

customer_reviews.title: Broaden your horizens!
customer_reviews.text: I actually didn't know this product existed except for a conversation with my gal pals at a ladies dinner night. Sure we all had our giggles but my friend was sold on this bidet and I now am too. Room temperature water is not the shock you might expect and after a brief learning curve I'm a happy camper and so is my husband. I bought the next model up for a different location, but that was not in any way better that this model. I do advise you to buy the metal fitting (Luxe Metal T-adapter with Shut-off Valve, 3-way Tee Connector, Chrome Finish, for Luxe Neo Bidets ) in place of the plastic one that is provided.
customer_reviews.author: Old Dog

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! You need this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have ever bought. That sounds crazy, you don’t think anyone needs a bidet, but trust me, you do. Once you start using this, you’ll never want to be without it. I need another one for our downstairs bathroom. We used to go through so much toilet paper and now we don’t! This makes you feel so clean. It’s such a good feeling. Even though it’s not warm water, it’s not horribly cold, especially once you’ve gotten used to using it. We recently remodeled our bathroom and had to go without this bidet for a week. I thought I was going to die. Also, the customer service is AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: KRH

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: Bidet cleansed as it should. Worked fine for a year until plastic knobs cracked & broke. You can't expect thin plastic to hold up to a brass fitting! I contacted seller for replacement parts (glad to purchase) just after warranty/return ran out (14 mo) but never heard back. So now it's in the trash & I've purchased a Leken with a sliding control. Also purchased a dual knob Leken as a gift to my kids & they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane W. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had been on fence on whether or not to get a bidet, and honestly lacked the knowledge of what makes a good one. After reading reviews on another one, I found a link to this make and model. I was surprised at how easy it is to install! I have pelvic floor dysfunction and IBS-C, so I had been going through a lot wipes to the point it was rubbing my skin to where it was sore. I still never felt clean afterwards. With this, it's been an amazing change! I feel like and refreshed when I go as opposed to blech I feel gross. Do yourself a favor and buy this and enjoy the difference!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Don't test while kneeling in front of toilet.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, quick setup. Cleaning toilet took longer than install. Use a crescent wrench and teflon tape, the included roll is minimal. Open the water valve slightly or incrementally to test the Velocity and Aim while sitting in place. Otherwise be aware that if you turn it on, expect a nozzle to drop down and fire a jet of water forward and upwards. Don't be mesmerized by the thing dropping down from behind the cover, thinking how neat that is.
customer_reviews.author: sharpie

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I recently went on a trip to Asia. Everywhere I went had a bidet or some sort of attachment hose next to the toilet. At first, I was hesitant since my culture has taught me that it was normal to just wipe messes with something dry, but I gave it a try and was ashamed of myself for not experiencing this level of clean sooner. When I returned home, I scoured the internet for a bidet attachment and found this one. This is one of the best things I purchased on Amazon and I'm so happy to have this in my life. I feel gross now using a toilet elsewhere that has no bidet.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole w

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: Personal cleanliness. Really there s nothing to dislike. I got the cold water option, and it does not freeze you. Hubby was busy so I connected it myself! Yeah, me! Pretty easy. Non electric, simply works on water pressure, which is adjustable. You'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: maha

customer_reviews.title: More people need to use this!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I knew about bidets sooner! Once you start using one, there is no going back :) I can't believe how much I miss this when I travel or go on holiday. The main benefits of using a bidet are it cleans much better than just toilet paper (in fact you never feel as clean without one) and you use less toilet paper (useful if your toilet clogs often). This is such a simple contraption, but yet so effective. To all those that find the pressure control to be inadequate in controlling the pressure, try adjusting the pressure/tap on the pipe before it forks out to the bidet. That worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: SweeeeeetAs

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is great, does what it needs to do. My toilet isn’t located near my sink so I couldn’t opt for the warm-water option. So far I don’t have any complaints about the cold water; it seems fine. Note that if your toilet is very close to the wall (or in my case, a built-in cabinet), you might not be able to install. You need a few inches clearance on the side. Ours ended up slightly crooked because of this but it hasn’t caused any problems. Definitely recommend. Edited to add: we definitely needed bumpers (purchased separately on Amazon). We have a Kohler round toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Retrofit Bidet- But please! Make a stronger metal on/off knob!
customer_reviews.text: This retrofit toilet bidet works wonderfully and is very easy to install. So glad I had it when toilet paper was hard to find during early pandemic. Cleans completely so TP is just for blot drying now and I use much less paper. Also I feel better about not contributing to the fatburgs problem. One bad thing about it is the on/off hard plastic knob. This needs to be stronger metal. It has cracked twice. Company replaced the knob promptly so they still get a great review. That said, this is a DESIGN FLAW that could, and should, be easily corrected at little expense to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: REAL REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: What a neat product and price
customer_reviews.text: The product is built very well and comes with quality fittings to make for a water tight plumbing installation. It took me about a half hour to install and operate. This is my first time living with a bidet. I must say it takes a little practice to get it right. Combination of water angle and pressure is the key. Too much water pressure and you’ll spray deflected soiled water everywhere. Remember there’s a little gap between your seat and the toilet itself so soiled water could find its way out. Plus you’ll find yourself swishing/brushing the bowl after every use (that’s a sign of too much water pressure). Great product.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure...
customer_reviews.text: So, installed it, was easy enough. It seemed to work fine. Then the nozzle started dripping and didn’t stop dripping. Not sure what causes this, couldn’t find any answer on the internet. Customer service is sending me another one which they said would arrive in 3 days and the tracking still shows it not even at a usps warehouse yet after 3 days. I’m going to have to take off the installed one for the new one so we’ll see if that one drips.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a test unit to see if I wanted to spend more on a good unit
customer_reviews.text: My first bidet, bought it as a test unit to see if I wanted to spend money on a good one. I used it and thought it was good, so I bought a biobidet electric bidet when it was on sale from costco. They don’t even compare, i wouldn’t even recommend this unit with it being 200 dollars cheaper than an electric one. The pressure is hard to control, feels like you tear your butt apart, and it doesn’t get as clean as the electric one would with much less pressure because the angles are different. Just my 2 cents
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Great bidet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bidet. Just be careful of the water pressure or else your butt will hurt like crazy - ask me how I know. I really liked the feature that cleans itself. I no longer have to try to wipe the spout. I've purchased several other brands of bidets here on Amazon and this is by far the best. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ches C

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better t-adapter
customer_reviews.text: The bidet itself works just as I expected but getting it to install was another story. You really shouldn't have to buy parts for something like this to get it to work. They t-adapter that comes with it would not stop leaking no matter what I did. I used the tape around it & everything but it was horrible. I almost broke the inside workings of my toilet trying to install. The only way I could get it to work is to order this part but I'm sure anything similar would work too:  After getting that new t-adapter part in the mail I had it installed within 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: TechAlly

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy nozzles; easy to install incorrectly; but works
customer_reviews.text: I like using a bidet, but the Luxe nozzles are flimsy. I had one that fell apart after 16 months. Water squirted everywhere except where it was intended to go. I recently purchased another identical Luxe figuring breakdown was a fluke. New one began malfunctioning after two months. I have to turn water on off on off on off to get it to spray. Not happy. Finally loosened the screws holding it to toilet and pulled it a wee bit away from the bowl rim. Now it’s working. I think the drop-down nozzles were pressed against the bowl unable to drop. Still I think that’s a defect.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Just WOW!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews that were so hysterical they brought me to tears from laughing, I HAD to try it. After using this, I will literally never go back to using paper or wipes. I get sad when visiting family/friends or when I'm on vacation and I don't have a bidet as an option. It works very well... and lets just say that the "low" spray option is as powerful as other reviews have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: T. Grove

customer_reviews.title: Very basic bidet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic bidet model. The pressure depends on the overall water pressure in your house. For us, there is no difference between the lowest and highest pressure. Also, there is no temperature variation, so it is always cold. I'm not sure that is going to be ok once winter begins. It was tricky to install, and now I'm afraid we are stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Whittemore

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I will admit, in the beginning I thought this was the weridest thing ever and I hated to use it. Now after a while, I only go to the bathroom that has this installed. Be sure to get someone who knows what they're doing to install this for you. I don't think you want to have your thigh sprayed. But after a while of using this Bidet, you get to love it. Also, in the long run, it could save you money on toilet paper. Just get a designated Bidet towel and you're good to go. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: If I Can Put it Together, You Can Too
customer_reviews.text: Install was super easy. Like putting together those target square shelves easy. I will say you’ve got to be careful and watch everything that moves when you try to screw in the hoses. There is a portion attached to your tank that isn’t supposed to be moved so be sure to keep it still while you’re tightening everything. Otherwise, it will leak. I gave 1 star for temperature control as there isn’t any, but the cold water is very refreshing. Also! Keep a towel handy because even though I turned the water off prior, I still have a slow bit of water coming out. Keep towel handy to place under hose before removal.
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd enter the world of Bidet's..... I picked this one as it looked easy to install and it was. It works great! ONLY problem is [and it's not this products fault] is that well when you spray ice cold water on your bottom that grabs your attention :) I then imagined doing this in the middle of winter and thought..... IF you're looking for an entry level bidet this one will work for you. I would suggest that you ease the water spray on slowly. I really liked the simplicity of this product and it did work with no leaks and NO issues. I would just prefer something that is a little warmer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: simple and does the job and the cost means one in each location
customer_reviews.text: A simple basic review...we lived in Europe for many years and learned to love a bidet, but alas Americans don't get it. We really did not want to actually install a free standing unit too expensive and complicated in our home. THEN these attached units came into the market and YEA! Works better than a stand alone and much simpler to use (and install). You will get used to the burst of cold water and come to appreciate the clean finish... LASTLY we have an ancient septic system (really ancient) and this reduced the paper usage by....80+ and that might be the best result
customer_reviews.author: Don Lj Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: This is life changing. You will never go back after having one of these. I'm kinda grossed out thinking of when I didn't have one just using toilet paper. I use wash clothes to dry and there is never any residue left behind. The only time I use tp now is when I'm on my period. I've saved a ton of money on tp and I'm sure my plumbing thanks me as well. It's a refreshing feeling to be able to clean yourself in this way throughout the day. I'm actually on here to buy another. This is an edit: I paid $35 for this. With the Corona going on they have doubled the price of this. Seems pretty unethical.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and it does the job
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and it does the job. Both my colorectal surgeon and gastroenterologist said "No more wiping; use a bidet attachment and pat dry." This one is well worth it. The only thing I recommend is buying a separate flor regulator valve to drop the water pressure coming out of the unit. The plastic connector that comes with the bidet doesn't allow for lowering the water pressure, which I learned the hard way by almost getting launched off the toilet seat the first time I used it!
customer_reviews.author: Herm Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Pressure washer for your bum
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, took me less than 10 minutes but was a little worried when I tested it and the spray nearly chipped the paint off my wall. The first time I tried it I was hit so hard I thought I was bleeding. It seemed too weird to try to return a bidet so I messed around with the knobs a little bit and found that if I put the spray/clean knob closer to the cleaning mode and then slowly advance the pressure it's pretty perfect and does the job, but beware, if you're not paying attention to your pressure setting you might get a little more intimate than you'd hoped!
customer_reviews.author: Rohebuks

customer_reviews.title: 4star product
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item 4 stars because the T adapter that was provided kept leaking. Yes, we put it on as directed but leaked using the provided black rubber washer!! So we went to HD to find another one and ended up buying the pictured Fill Valve Coupling Nut just to use the black rubber washer and plastic ring that were inside of it. The extra supplies were under $5 but the hassle of going to the store and trying to figure out what would work, makes me knock off a star. With the better washer and ring, it sealed perfectly! No leaking and the bidet works great so far!
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: OMG Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Why did it take me till the age of 51 to experience this?! I’ve thought about it before, but it wasn’t until everyone lost their damn minds over this corona virus thing and started hoarding all the TP, that I decided now’s the time! Thank you corona virus! If it hadn’t been for you, I might never been able to experience the wonderful world of bidets. I’ll never go back!
customer_reviews.author: James L. Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: You won't go wrong.....feeling like somewhere over the rainbow
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible back and sciatic issues so my cousin told me about this...and with all my pain i have pain just trying to turn or bend i needed some help and relief...My husband installed it this morning and i gave it a Whirl....omgosh does the trick..i feel as fresh as a daisy and do not need to take pain meds to go to the bathroom anymore....I'm serious about this...One less thing to worry about during my day...!! So happy i purchased this...Thank you for making a great product...was easy to install...hubby had it done in about 15mins...dar happy camper!!
customer_reviews.author: james young

customer_reviews.title: Good BUT!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to install and works well. I needed to buy longer bolts because my current bolts were short when I install the bidet underneath the seat. I also bought seat bumpers to adjust the seat (it will be nice if they are provided with the bidet). I gave it 2 stars because the water pressure control dial is not working, it is always high-pressure water. It is also hard to clean the toilet behind the nozzle. Update: I increase my rating to 4 stars because I have it from more than 3 years ago and it is still working great. I only needed to buy a knob because the original one was broken.
customer_reviews.author: SEMSEM

customer_reviews.title: Cleanliness is next to Godliness!
customer_reviews.text: A little delayed due to the World Situation right now, however when it did ship it was fast without any damages. Others reviews were both humorous and true not leaving me much to say except that this is wonderful. When I first heard about these devices I thought it was a feminine thing. I was ever so wrong, a clean butt is a healthy butt and body. I have registered and will be buying an additional one as soon as I'm done tiling my other bathroom. Best decision I've made since toilet paper has been held hostage! Get one as soon as you can, well worth it! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lege

customer_reviews.title: keep on drinkin beer and eating hot wings with this bad boy
customer_reviews.text: So im at my friends house,ong story short i left feeling like i peed myself. Next thing i know i got my own personal super soaker in the toilet, and man oh man are the hangover burns over with. I am living in a new era of painless buns!! This thing does slide around a little, as much as your toilet seat does. It has a long throw pressure witch from low to high, but the reality is from dollar store water gun to pressure washer. It truely takes finess to find an in between. Easy install, easy on the eyes, and tough on that booty stank.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Good product with just one drawback
customer_reviews.text: There are significant benefits to having this kind of stream bidet. The only drawback was our toilet seat would have needed to be raised to install this device, and while that is doable, but it I did not want a space where it could splash out so returned it. Handheld wand bidets are a little messy in comparison so I really think this version is a good option if you don’t mind finding door stops to raise the seat.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Clean and serene
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much I bought one for my parents. I've been wanting to get a bidet forever, the pandemic just gave me an extra push. I researched good basic starter ones that weren't too pricy and kept this one in my cart for a year. Unfortunately the price was raised ridiculously high during the pandemic so I was hesitant. But I'm glad I pushed through because this thing is heaven. It was super easy to install, and works well for front and back (reposition). It is not heated which is fine because I'm not set up for it in my bathroom. It's powerful so start light and slowly increase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mitchell

product_meta.title: Luxe Bidet Neo 120 - Self Cleaning Nozzle - Fresh Water Non-Electric Mechanical Bidet Toilet Attachment (blue and white)
product_meta.description:
Color:Blue/WhiteProduct Description Features: High Quality Metal-Ceramic Core Valves. Steel Braided Hose. Innovative Hygienic Nozzle Guard Gate. Self-Cleaning Nozzle Function - Available with Neo 120, Neo 180 and Neo 320. Standard white body and chrome-plated controls. Sleek, curved shape fits most two-piece toilets. Do It Yourself Installation. Adjustable fitting plates for secure attachment. All standard plumbing size accessories included. From the Manufacturer Features: High Quality Metal-Ceramic Core Valves. Steel Braided Hose. Innovative Hygienic Nozzle Guard Gate. Self-Cleaning Nozzle Function - Available with Neo 120, Neo 180, and Neo 320. Standard white body and chrome-plated controls. Sleek, curved shape fits most two-piece toilets. Do It Yourself Installation. Adjustable fitting plates for secure attachment. All standard plumbing size accessories included. Toilet Dimensions: Center of toilet to the edge: maximum 7. 75 inches. Distance between the two screws: between 3. 5 to 8. 25 inches. Distance f

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Features: High Quality Metal-Ceramic Core Valves. Steel Braided Hose. Innovative Hygienic Nozzle Guard Gate. Self-Cleaning Nozzle Function - Available with Neo 120, Neo 180, and Neo 320. Standard white body and chrome-plated controls. Sleek, curved shape fits most two-piece toilets. Do It Yourself Installation. Adjustable fitting plates for secure attachment. All standard plumbing size accessories included. Toilet Dimensions: Center of toilet to the edge: maximum 7.75 inches. Distance between the two screws: between 3.5 to 8.25 inches. Distance from screw to toilet tank: minimum 1 inch. Distance from the screw to the edge of the toilet bowl: between 1.25 to 3.5 inches. Distance from the center of the toilet to the wall: minimum 11.5 inches.
feature_bullets: A LUXURIOUS LOOK AT AN EXCELLENT PRICE- With its sleek design, chrome-plated knobs, and high-quality parts, our bidet attachment will give your bathroom a next-level look. Constructed with high-pressure faucet quality valves with metal/ceramic cores and braided steel hoses instead of traditional plastic.

HYGIENIC NOZZLE GUARD GATE – Designed to shield the nozzle for your ultimate sanitary experience. The nozzle automatically retracts behind the guard gate after each wash to ensure it is protected until your next use. You could also choose to clean the nozzle itself.
HAVE FUN DOING IT YOURSELF - Includes ALL PARTS AND TOOLS to get your bidet up and running in minutes. Easily attaches to and detaches from any standard two-piece toilet.
ENVIRONMENTALLY-FRIENDLY, WORTHWHILE INVESTMENT – Save money (and trees!) on toilet paper. Cleaning with our bidet is gentle on your skin and sustainable for the planet.

NO KIDDING 18-MONTH WARRANTY – We are always here to make sure you are 100% satisfied, so anytime if you have problems or concerns about the products, we are just one call away. Register your bidet online and get an extended warranty.
